abstract: The oil giant won court orders freezing as much as $12 billion in petroleum assets controlled by Venezuela’s government.
snippet: The oil giant won court orders freezing as much as $12 billion in petroleum assets controlled by Venezuela’s government.
lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela  The oil giant Exxon Mobil has won court orders freezing as much as $12 billion in petroleum assets controlled by Venezuela’s government in an escalation of a dispute over efforts by President Hugo Chávez to assert greater control over the country’s oil industry.

headline.main: Court Bars Sale of Billions in Oil Assets by Venezuela
headline.print_headline: Court Bars Sale of Billions in Oil Assets Held by Venezuela
